title: PICS: Check in at Janse + Co for the fanciest bar snacks in Cape Town
text:

Janse & Co is situated in the iconic Kloof street of Cape Town, home to some of city's exciting foodie spots.

And while it has been open for almost two years, many who have not been here in a while will be quite surprised at the transformation of what used to be the city's first Cape Town Fish Market.

At the helm of the transformation is the rough-around-the-edges owner and chef, Arno Janse van Rensburg.

While he describes it as a casual fine dining restaurant offering a tasting menu, emphasising fresh, local & seasonal ingredients - it really is a quite fancy, yet not in a pretentious way.

As we sat in the courtyard of the newly refurbished bar area sampling the summer menu - packed with seasonal produce just as the chef likes it - you'll find it hard to remember that you're just a stone's throw from one of the bustling parts of the city's CBD.

It's tranquil and lush, and quite down to earth - much like Chef Arno.

But there's some serious heat happening in this kitchen with Janse + Co having won the Eat Out Best New Restaurant of the year in 2018 and having been long-listed for the best new restaurants in the World Restaurant Awards.

So why is Arno and his team excited about the summer season ahead?

"We've been testing some new ingredients, we're expanding our charcuterie range and our cheese-making skills have improved dramatically," he says.

During the leisurely tasting, guests were not only treated to the dishes that make up the tasting menu options, starting from 3 courses at R385 or at R760 include wine - but we also sampled some of the bar snacks available to order.

These included Squid Ink Fish Crisps, Aioli, Fish Floss & Chives, Pork Crackling and Lowerland Pecan Nuts.

And true to the entrance art mural that showcases South African edible flowers, the menu is beautifully flavoured with them too.

Nasturium Flowes, SoutSlaai and an absolute favourite Dune Spinach.

Sticking to his guns with the sustainable and seasonal, Arno makes hearty work of Skipjack, a type of tuna that is brought to life with jalapeno and kale.

Janse + Co is also smartly on point with its kombucha aperitifs flavour with either fynbos or a sharp shot of coffee.

(Photos: Selene Brophy)

This is no ordinary eatery on Kloof, come hungry and be sure to book in advance.



*Disclaimer: Traveller24 Editor Selene Brophy was hosted for the summer menu tasting by Janse+Co.
